antiPatterns.name: Strict Layers Violation
antiPatterns.description: In this scenario, one cannot reliably prevent that strict layers are violated. It can always happen that a layer skips the one directly beneath it and accesses a layer further below instead
antiPatterns.consequences: alterability is affected. The number of a layer's potential clients will increase, and the dependency between layers will grow.
antiPatterns.cause: Since the common programming languages do not provide concepts for the definition of layers, layers must be built based on conventions.
sources: @book{Lippert, title={Refactoring in large software projects: performing complex restructurings successfully}, author={Lippert, Martin and Roock, Stephen}, year={2006}, publisher={John Wiley & Sons}}
